intro: Boscia mossambicensis, commonly known as the African wild apricot, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its small, green, fleshy fruits that turn orange when mature. The plant has small, alternate leaves and produces yellow flowers that attract pollinators. It is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. The fruit is edible and has been used traditionally for its nutritional value.
